meanings.sent1: Tom tends to bellyache whenever he has to do his chores.
meanings.sent2: Please don't bellyache about having to help with the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The cat started to bellyache when it saw the new brand of food in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: She would bellyache about the weather even if it was sunny every day.
meanings.sent5: The children continued to bellyache until their parents agreed to take them to the park.

meanings.definition: A pain or discomfort in the stomach or abdomen
meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, Sarah had a bellyache all night.
meanings.sent2: He got a bellyache from eating too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The bellyache from the spicy food made him regret his choice.
meanings.sent4: Her bellyache felt like a tiny monster was growling inside her stomach.
meanings.sent5: The bellyache was so intense that she had to lie down and rest.
